description: With its 190 km, the Göta Canal offers a unique paddle environment. The canal has both longer and shorter paddle-friendly stretches with many attractions along the way.
Here you can experience crystal clear water from your SUP board, while you breathe refreshing mountain air. At Åresjön, paddling is offered on remote beaches overlooking mountain peaks.
Float over the oysters and feel the salt in the air. On the west coast, surrounded by fine beaches and archipelago classic boathouses, you can paddle among cobs and skerries.
On the peninsula Kullen are Kullaberg's dramatic cliffs that stretch out to Öresund. If you are lucky on your side, you may encounter a seal or a porpoise during the adventure.
From Reimersholme you can discover Stockholm from the water by paddling to Kungsholmen and further towards the city center.
Paddle through the Durdle Door arch and explore one of the best SUP destinations in europe with white-cliff coasts and caves.
The picturesque Slovenian lake with a small island in the middle. The boats are crowded out here - so why don't you jump on your paddleboard to explore it?
Paddle in the famouse grottoes of Pinta da Piedade in Lagos and you will encounter a magical SUP tour.
Enjoy the small fishing towns from an Arctic enviroment. Unique and delightful landscape like no other!
Paddle alongside the gondolas in Venice and enjoy the city from the water.
A beautiful little Mexican paradise north of Yucatan Peninsula with a lagoon full of pelicans and flamingos.
This largest alpine lake in North America, is perhaps the most photographed SUP location in the world. Conditions are great from late spring until early fall.
An archipelago of 40 coral islands surrounded by turquoise waters, the Turks and Caicos Islands are a paddleboarding haven.
The place where SUP was born. Hawaii has everything a paddle boarder could ever want. Look out for sea turtles and whales.
Glide on the pristine waters of Boracay and enjoy the natural beauty around. Perfect for beginners.
